title: MINDS - die "eierlegende Wollmilchsau"?
body:
Was ist das fÃ¼r ein Titel? Wir Ã–sterreicher sagen zu einem Produkt das eigentlich alles kann â€œ**eierlegende Wollmilchsau**â€. Doch wie passt das zu **[Minds](https://www.minds.com/register?referrer=moneyfoxx)**?

Wie ihr bereits wisst, bin ich absoluter Fan von **Projekten auf der Blockchain**. Es vergeht kein Tag an dem ich nicht mindestens ein Projekt nÃ¤her unter die Lupe nehme. Mir geht es dabei bei vielen Projekten nicht um den Gewinn, sondern um das Projekt selbst.

### Minds sollte Standard werden!

[Minds](https://www.minds.com/register?referrer=moneyfoxx) ist eine Plattform die fÃ¼r viele Dinge genutzt werden kann. FÃ¼r Business Kunden ist es eine Kombination aus **Webseite, Blog, Newsfeed und Social Media**, alles verbunden auf einer einzigen Plattform. Wer sich jetzt als Unternehmen auf Minds Pro setzt, kann mit einem **Einmalkauf** lebenslang die besten Funktionen der Plattform nutzen.

ZusÃ¤tzlich ist es viel einfacher BeitrÃ¤ge auf MINDS zu **bewerben**, als auf allen Anderen Plattformen, da es ja mit deinem Wallet verbunden ist.

Warum nutzen Blockchain Projekte **Discord**? Ganz ehrlich, ich weiÃŸ es nicht. Besonders Blockchain Projekte sollten eine dezentrale Plattform unterstÃ¼tzten. Hilfst du mir, helfe ich dir.

### Soll ich Minds auch nutzen?

Ganz einfach beantwortet **JA**! Auch wenn die Anzahl der User noch nicht mit Facebook, Instagram oder Twitter vergleichbar ist, sollten wir als Krypto Freaks dezentrale Plattformen nutzen. Minds ist in erster Linie ein **Ersatz fÃ¼r Facebook**, kann jedoch noch viel mehr. Du bekommst ebenso **Belohnungen** fÃ¼r das Halten von Token, wenn du LiquiditÃ¤t zur VerfÃ¼gung stellst und wenn Leute auf deine BeitrÃ¤ge reagieren.

ZusÃ¤tzlich mÃ¼ssen die Leute die Interesse an deinen BeitrÃ¤gen haben nicht bei Minds anmelden um deinen Content lesen zu kÃ¶nnen.

![Du kannst bares Geld verdienen.](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/_27Nk4j0KyplKsO7OggAO.png?height=794&width=1065)

### Funktionen von Minds

Auf die gesamte Palette an Funktionen die Minds, Minds+ oder Minds Pro bieten, kann ich in diesem Artikel gar nicht eingehen. Unternehmen die Interesse an Minds haben, kÃ¶nnen mich Ã¼ber [mein Profil](https://www.minds.com/moneyfoxx/) gerne persÃ¶nlich kontaktieren.

FÃ¼r dich als Krypto Freak bietet die Plattform:

* Feed (Facebook, Twitter) und du wirst fÃ¼r deine BeitrÃ¤ge und AktivitÃ¤t belohnt
* Chat und Gruppenchat
* Stories
* Video Plattform
* Redefreiheit (keine Zensur durch staatliche Instanzen, jedoch Community PrÃ¼fung)
* Blog (ich verwende hier aktuell mirror.xyz)
* VerdienstmÃ¶glichkeiten (zB fÃ¼r Blogger, Influencer,â€¦)
* einfach Geld senden

### Die Zukunft von Minds

Hoffentlich bringen wir sehr viele Leute dazu dezentrale Plattformen zu nutzen, auch wenn es zu Beginn mÃ¼hsam ist. Minds ist fÃ¼r mich ein **absoluter Favorit**, da es fast unendliche MÃ¶glichkeiten bietet. ZusÃ¤tzlich setzt sich Minds fÃ¼r die Redefreiheit von uns Allen ein. Ich bitte euch, arbeiten wir gemeinsam an einer dezentralen Zukunft. **[Gibt Minds eine Chance!](https://www.minds.com/register?referrer=moneyfoxx)**

title: Brands are all about the details
body:
July 3, 2022 DAY111


When creating a brand for a product, it is the details that matter. Brands are formed by creating each and every content with a concept and attention to detail. The brand becomes a source of value for the customer and a source of business. The devil's in the details.

6\.ä»å®Œå…¨ä¿¡æ¯åˆ°ä¸å®Œå…¨ä¿¡æ¯ã€‚æ–°å¤å…¸ç»æµå­¦å‡è®¾ä¿¡æ¯æ˜¯å®Œå…¨çš„ï¼Œä½†ç°å®ä¸­äººä»¬å¾€å¾€å¾—ä¸åˆ°å®Œå…¨ä¿¡æ¯ï¼Œå¹¶ä¸”ä¿¡æ¯åœ¨ä¸åŒäººä¹‹é—´å¾€å¾€æ˜¯ä¸å¯¹ç§°çš„ã€‚æ–°å¤å…¸ç»æµå­¦è®¤ä¸ºå¸‚åœºå¯ä»¥é€šè¿‡ä»·æ ¼æ¥è°ƒèŠ‚ä¾›éœ€ï¼Œäºæ˜¯æ³¢å…°ç»æµå­¦å®¶Oskar Langeï¼ˆ1904-1965ï¼‰æŒ‡å‡ºï¼Œå¯ä»¥è®©ä¸­å¤®è®¡åˆ’è€…æ¥æ¨¡æ‹Ÿå¸‚åœºï¼Œç”¨è™šæ‹Ÿçš„æŠ¥ä»·æ¥è°ƒèŠ‚ä¾›éœ€ï¼Œè¿™æ ·è®¡åˆ’ç»æµå°±å¯è¡Œäº†ï¼Œè¿™å«å¸‚åœºç¤¾ä¼šä¸»ä¹‰ã€‚1945å¹´å¥¥åœ°åˆ©ç»æµå­¦å®¶Friedrich Hayekï¼ˆ1899-1992ï¼‰å‘è¡¨è®ºæ–‡ã€ŠThe Use of Knowledge in Societyã€‹å›åº”ï¼ŒæŒ‡å‡ºè®¡åˆ’ç»æµä¹‹æ‰€ä»¥ä¸å¯è¡Œï¼Œå…³é”®åœ¨äºä¿¡æ¯ã€‚æ¯ä¸ªäººæ‹¥æœ‰çš„ä¿¡æ¯æ˜¯ä¸ä¸€æ ·çš„ï¼Œå¸‚åœºæœºåˆ¶ä¸­ä»·æ ¼çš„ä½œç”¨ä¸åªæ˜¯è°ƒèŠ‚ä¾›éœ€ï¼Œæ›´æ˜¯ä¼ é€’ä¿¡æ¯ï¼Œè€Œé ä¸­å¤®è®¡åˆ’è€…ä¼ é€’ä¿¡æ¯æ•ˆç‡ä¼šå¾ˆä½ã€‚1951å¹´Arrowå‡ºç‰ˆè‘—ä½œã€ŠSocial Choice and Individual Valuesã€‹ï¼Œå»ºç«‹äº†ç¤¾ä¼šé€‰æ‹©ç†è®ºï¼Œç ”ç©¶äººä»¬çš„åå¥½ä¸ä¸€æ ·æ—¶å¦‚ä½•åŠ æ€»çš„é—®é¢˜ã€‚åˆ°70å¹´ä»£ç¾å›½ç»æµå­¦å®¶Leonid HurwiczæŠŠArrowçš„ç¤¾ä¼šé€‰æ‹©ç†è®ºå’ŒHayekçš„ä¿¡æ¯ä¼ é€’ç†è®ºç»“åˆèµ·æ¥ï¼Œå»ºç«‹äº†æœºåˆ¶è®¾è®¡ç†è®ºã€‚æœºåˆ¶è®¾è®¡ç†è®ºå’Œå‰é¢æåˆ°çš„åšå¼ˆè®ºæ˜¯åçš„ï¼Œåšå¼ˆè®ºæ˜¯ç»™å®šè§„åˆ™æ±‚ç»“æœï¼Œè€Œæœºåˆ¶è®¾è®¡ç†è®ºæ˜¯ç»™å®šç»“æœè®¾è®¡è§„åˆ™ã€‚æœºåˆ¶è®¾è®¡ç†è®ºæ˜¯ç°åœ¨åœ¨ä¸å®Œå…¨ä¿¡æ¯ä¸‹åšç ”ç©¶çš„åŸºæœ¬æ¡†æ¶ï¼Œæœ‰ä¸¤ä¸ªç ”ç©¶æ–¹å‘ï¼Œä¸€ä¸ªæ˜¯ä¿¡æ¯ä¼ é€’ï¼Œä¸€ä¸ªæ˜¯æ‰§è¡Œç»“æœã€‚ä»æœºåˆ¶è®¾è®¡çš„è§’åº¦çœ‹ï¼Œå¸‚åœºã€æ”¿åºœã€ä¼ä¸šéƒ½åªæ˜¯è®©åå¥½å’Œä¿¡æ¯ä¸åŒçš„ä¸ªäººè·å¾—æ¿€åŠ±çš„æœºåˆ¶ï¼Œå„æœ‰å…¶é€‚ç”¨èŒƒå›´ã€‚

title: The Demon Market in The Library
body:
**The Library is an open space dedicated to the pursuit of understanding. It lies deep within the Weird Wilds, hidden in plain sight. When a WITCH crosses the threshold into the Library, they enter a realm filled with knowledge of all kinds and discover a quiet sanctuary from any and all chaos circles.**Â 

Tomes, scrolls, books, and texts line the orderly shelves of the Library. There are many tales of MAGES lost for weeks within these very shelves, all in search of the arcane. Many become consumed by this pursuit for the Library conceals the most comprehensive collection of ancient texts and forbidden knowledge within its endless shelves.Â 

[Neutrino, the Incessant Map](https://www.cryptocoven.xyz/witches/8353) was one of these MAGES. They were born with a compulsion to document all knowledge, especially the forbidden. Soulbound hexes, ancient cursed objects, arcane spells, Neutrino sought to collect it all.Â 

Though, as the Head Librarian and a WITCH who lives in the light, they could not openly embrace such dark fascinations. They had vowed to embrace the light long ago, distancing themselves from their past forged through chaos.

When the moon calls, Neutrino ventures into the night in search of cursed artifacts, and the Library is reborn into a popup demon marketâ€”fully embracing chaos under the watchful eyes of [KAGS](https://opensea.io/assets/ethereum/0x29b4d6c1d5ebedb62e5913f1c47b6b0421f1ec38/6), Neutrinoâ€™s familiar. The CAT of CHAOS welcomes all WITCHES and creatures in the dead of night under the full moon.

To enter the demon market, a small sacrifice is requiredâ€”a secret script or scintillating secret. KAGS, perched atop an ancient tome, passes judgment upon every contribution. Few dare attempt to out-wile the CAT of CHAOS with a forged script or meager rumor lest they end up buried beneath a shelf of dense tomes.Â 

The Library hums with disorderly bartering. Sacred tomes, arcane scrolls, forbidden texts, cursed objects, [soul vessels](https://opensea.io/collection/crypto-coven-curse-of-the-void-witch), and [familiar jars](https://opensea.io/collection/void-coven-cats) are all found within the demon market. Some nights there are even â€œrareâ€ [siren shells](https://opensea.io/collection/sirens-shell) sold to unsuspecting travelers just outside the Library doors.Â 

Seasoned demon market traders know to ignore the barrage of â€œyoâ€™sâ€ outside the Library. No secrets are found thereâ€”just minor tricksters conning the unsuspecting with dubious offers. A soul vessel and the secret recipe for perfectly fried French fries for a small handful of the kingâ€™s jewels?Â 

Most happily pay the price of admission and leave with due haste once they acquire the items they seek. Stay too long and a true trickster may swap a sacred tome with one filled with empty words and false promises. For many, this is a rite of passage to show that one belongs in the demon market.Â 

KAGS revels in the chaos of the market, his eyes glimmering with flames as he watches every shady interaction. In one corner, the infamous â€œNyxâ€ places a tarot deck on a sturdy oak table. She ensnares a doe-eyed marketgoer with a promise that her cards will guide them to their darkest desire.Â 

She firmly places their hand on her deck and whispers an incantation. She poses a simple question before pulling from her deck. Their lips move but their voice is absent. A ruse. Nyx places a sirenâ€™s shell against the marketgoerâ€™s ear and names her price: a bakerâ€™s dozen of The Pistachioâ€™s signature pistachio macarons and an unnamed favor.Â 

[Pistachioâ€™s patisserie](https://cryptocoven.xyz/tree-of-echoes/the-pistachio-68) is a staple of every demon market. She hands out a sample of her pistachio macarons to every soul as a gesture of goodwill, to welcome them to the demon market. Little do they know, they will be back before the sun rises. Half a dozen? A bakerâ€™s dozen? Two dozen? The only limit is the number of macarons Pistachio brings.Â 

In another aisle, KAGS watches [Centauri, the Virtuous Chalk](https://cryptocoven.xyz/tree-of-echoes/suspended-in-chalk) enter the market and immediately exchange a handful of gold coins for two dozen pistachio macarons. She then lies in wait, as she does each full moon, producing chalk-drawn sketches to pass the time.

When The Pistachio sells out, Centauri goes forth and frolics among the chaos. Armed with the most coveted baked goods, she barters her way to the knowledge she seeks. A rumor here, an ancient tome there, Centauri trades pistachio macarons for every morsel of information she can find.Â 

As the thrum of the market slows, KAGS grows bored and restless. He unleashes a bone-chilling howl to signal the end of the demon market. Everyone dashes to the exit, fearful of a sting from KAGSâ€™ venomous scorpion tail or the unrelenting singe from his claws dipped in black fire.

Neutrino returns to The Library in total disarrayâ€”tomes, scrolls, texts, and books scattered everywhere. They apologize profusely to their fellow librarians, casting blame on KAGS and his penchant for chaos. KAGS hisses, feigning disdain, and retreats to his favorite bookshelf where six slices of the finest fresh tuna await him for a job well done.

title: DANGER ZONE: Details
body:
> *â€œWeb3â€™s most anticipated projectâ€ - The community*

The first project to come out of the [Danger Zone DAO](https://twitter.com/DangerZoneDAO) will be the â€œDanger Zoneâ€ EP and we couldnâ€™t be happier. Without the support of the community, the [crowdfund](https://ibn.mirror.xyz/crowdfunds/0xAD1fE534cb1bEA44a67307164Da9C03b763815bE) backers and many others we wouldnâ€™t be here today.

*For those who donâ€™t knowâ€¦*

### I AM

### IBN INGLOR

![FWB x ZORA - SXSW '22 Performance | Photography by Angel Darmella Eâ€™Stash](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/vNcchoICiMyN_0OxpdF9d.JPG?height=1152&width=2048)

Born and raised on Chicagoâ€™s far Southside, Iâ€™m an alternative hip-hop artist who is making major waves in Web3. I was able to raise 20 ETH through Mirror's crowdfunding tool, which I used to fund the first [Danger Zone DAO](https://twitter.com/DangerZoneDAO) project, "DANGER ZONE: The Album", as well as start one of the first creator DAOs. In addition, I was the first Hip-Hop artist to release music on [Sound.xyz](https://www.sound.xyz/ibninglor), and Iâ€™ve grown from being the artist who was *"[too ambitious without enough support](https://twitter.com/IbnInglor/status/1452444679895670785?s=20&t=NfU3XolWJjr9XCusG5mnTQ)"* to building a whole community of believers.

Prior to Web3, Iâ€™ve released projects that garnered attention from major publications. My distinctive sound as well as my dedication to exploring original ideas had my earlier releases featured in [The FADER Magazine](https://www.thefader.com/artist/ibn-inglor), [Hypebeast](https://hypebeast.com/tags/ibn-inglor), [Noisey](https://www.vice.com/en/article/rq4a3w/premiere-chicago-rapper-ibn-inglor-fights-back-depression-with-pray-for-health), and had me listed in [Complexâ€™s annual â€œ25 New Rappers to Watch Out Forâ€](https://www.complex.com/music/2013/07/25-new-rappers-to-watch-out-for/ibn-inglor?utm_campaign=complexmag+socialflow+07+2013&utm_source=twitter&utm_medium=social). My latest project is a symbol of hope to the children of Chicago's most violent neighborhoods, while also offering a theatrical experience to the listeners.

[crowdfund://0xAD1fE534cb1bEA44a67307164Da9C03b763815bE?features=editions](crowdfund://0xAD1fE534cb1bEA44a67307164Da9C03b763815bE?features=editions)

## DANGER ZONE: The Album

![Album Cover by: Nate York](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/GeiNwQhI50ez9GF-ih2_7.png?height=3000&width=3000)

***An expressive, exhilarating ride of raw emotion.***

My seven-track album is a reflection of my world and upbringing.

1. Danger Zone
2. Jaw (feat. DuffleGang Gizzle)
3. Blinded by The Love
4. How Could I Ever (feat. Arran Sym)
5. Interlude
6. Talk Dirty (feat. Kevin Sinatra)
7. Family Matters (feat. Reef Loretto)

**Music Production by:** Arran Sym & Brandon Mahone

**Mastering by**: Collin Jordan

**Executive Produced by:** Danger Zone DAO

[crowdfund://0xAD1fE534cb1bEA44a67307164Da9C03b763815bE?features=backers](crowdfund://0xAD1fE534cb1bEA44a67307164Da9C03b763815bE?features=backers)

## Who, Where & Wen Mint?

[Danger Zone DAO](https://twitter.com/DangerZoneDAO) members, [Sound.xyz](https://www.sound.xyz/ibninglor), [Catalog](https://beta.catalog.works/ibninglor), and [Glass Protocol](https://glass.xyz/v/ZuoxqZRFDykGiGPNfgv_vnFbR8B0d2D-3pw2-lXbBns=) collectors holding their [Membership NFT cards](https://twitter.com/DangerZoneDAO/status/1537960671886749697?s=20&t=AA6PxuqMOpAGtMvqd4I9Cw) have received early access to preview the project [here!](https://ibninglor.xyz/dangerzone)

[https://twitter.com/DangerZoneDAO/status/1537960671886749697?s=20&t=AA6PxuqMOpAGtMvqd4I9Cw](https://twitter.com/DangerZoneDAO/status/1537960671886749697?s=20&t=AA6PxuqMOpAGtMvqd4I9Cw)

Pre-mint access can also be obtained by purchasing available Music NFTs on secondary via [Sound.xyz](https://opensea.io/collection/ibn-inglor) & [Catalog](https://beta.catalog.works/ibninglor/i-know).

### Public mint goes live July 7th at 7pm UTC.

## 2 Communities âš¡ï¸ 1 Vision

The more I learned about web3, the more I realized how valuable the developers in this space are and how little attention and recognition they receive. With this drop, I wanted to ensure that I not only gave back to my community IRL, but also to my online community, the devs and builders of web3.

### Developer DAO Partnership

* I am partnering with [Developer DAO](https://twitter.com/developer_dao) to help onboard more Chicago-based developers and communities of color into web3. To kick things off I will be giving away three Developer DAO membership NFTs to developers in Chicago who want to jump into web3. More updates and announcements on this partnership to come.

### Danger Zone DAO Scholarship

* 10% of the album proceeds, will go towards creating the [Danger Zone DAO](https://twitter.com/DangerZoneDAO) Scholarship Fund. The DAO will award two seniors from my alma mater computer science scholarships to study at any in-state university of their choice.
* Scholarship recipients will also be offered a paid internship with our DAO partners after their freshman year of college to gain hands-on, practical work experience along with mentorship from the awesome people at [Developer DAO](https://twitter.com/developer_dao).

## THANK YOU!

To **EVERYONE** involved in making this album a reality! This journey has been nothing short of amazing, and I am extremely grateful to be building here and receiving such tremendous support from everyone.

> *â€œWeb3â€™s most anticipated projectâ€ - The community*

The first project to come out of the [Danger Zone DAO](https://twitter.com/DangerZoneDAO) will be the â€œDanger Zoneâ€ EP and we couldnâ€™t be happier. Without the support of the community, the [crowdfund](https://ibn.mirror.xyz/crowdfunds/0xAD1fE534cb1bEA44a67307164Da9C03b763815bE) backers and many others we wouldnâ€™t be here today.

*For those who donâ€™t knowâ€¦*

### I AM

### IBN INGLOR

![FWB x ZORA - SXSW '22 Performance | Photography by Angel Darmella Eâ€™Stash](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/vNcchoICiMyN_0OxpdF9d.JPG?height=1152&width=2048)

Born and raised on Chicagoâ€™s far Southside, Iâ€™m an alternative hip-hop artist who is making major waves in Web3. I was able to raise 20 ETH through Mirror's crowdfunding tool, which I used to fund the first [Danger Zone DAO](https://twitter.com/DangerZoneDAO) project, "DANGER ZONE: The Album", as well as start one of the first creator DAOs. In addition, I was the first Hip-Hop artist to release music on [Sound.xyz](https://www.sound.xyz/ibninglor), and Iâ€™ve grown from being the artist who was *"[too ambitious without enough support](https://twitter.com/IbnInglor/status/1452444679895670785?s=20&t=NfU3XolWJjr9XCusG5mnTQ)"* to building a whole community of believers.

Prior to Web3, Iâ€™ve released projects that garnered attention from major publications. My distinctive sound as well as my dedication to exploring original ideas had my earlier releases featured in [The FADER Magazine](https://www.thefader.com/artist/ibn-inglor), [Hypebeast](https://hypebeast.com/tags/ibn-inglor), [Noisey](https://www.vice.com/en/article/rq4a3w/premiere-chicago-rapper-ibn-inglor-fights-back-depression-with-pray-for-health), and had me listed in [Complexâ€™s annual â€œ25 New Rappers to Watch Out Forâ€](https://www.complex.com/music/2013/07/25-new-rappers-to-watch-out-for/ibn-inglor?utm_campaign=complexmag+socialflow+07+2013&utm_source=twitter&utm_medium=social). My latest project is a symbol of hope to the children of Chicago's most violent neighborhoods, while also offering a theatrical experience to the listeners.

[crowdfund://0xAD1fE534cb1bEA44a67307164Da9C03b763815bE?features=editions](crowdfund://0xAD1fE534cb1bEA44a67307164Da9C03b763815bE?features=editions)

## DANGER ZONE: The Album

![Album Cover by: Nate York](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/GeiNwQhI50ez9GF-ih2_7.png?height=3000&width=3000)

***An expressive, exhilarating ride of raw emotion.***

My seven-track album is a reflection of my world and upbringing.

1. Danger Zone
2. Jaw (feat. DuffleGang Gizzle)
3. Blinded by The Love
4. How Could I Ever (feat. Arran Sym)
5. Interlude
6. Talk Dirty (feat. Kevin Sinatra)
7. Family Matters (feat. Reef Loretto)

**Music Production by:** Arran Sym & Brandon Mahone

**Mastering by**: Collin Jordan

**Executive Produced by:** Danger Zone DAO

[crowdfund://0xAD1fE534cb1bEA44a67307164Da9C03b763815bE?features=backers](crowdfund://0xAD1fE534cb1bEA44a67307164Da9C03b763815bE?features=backers)

## Who, Where & Wen Mint?

[Danger Zone DAO](https://twitter.com/DangerZoneDAO) members, [Sound.xyz](https://www.sound.xyz/ibninglor), [Catalog](https://beta.catalog.works/ibninglor), and [Glass Protocol](https://glass.xyz/v/ZuoxqZRFDykGiGPNfgv_vnFbR8B0d2D-3pw2-lXbBns=) collectors holding their [Membership NFT cards](https://twitter.com/DangerZoneDAO/status/1537960671886749697?s=20&t=AA6PxuqMOpAGtMvqd4I9Cw) have received early access to preview the project [here!](https://ibninglor.xyz/dangerzone)

[https://twitter.com/DangerZoneDAO/status/1537960671886749697?s=20&t=AA6PxuqMOpAGtMvqd4I9Cw](https://twitter.com/DangerZoneDAO/status/1537960671886749697?s=20&t=AA6PxuqMOpAGtMvqd4I9Cw)

Pre-mint access can also be obtained by purchasing available Music NFTs on secondary via [Sound.xyz](https://opensea.io/collection/ibn-inglor) & [Catalog](https://beta.catalog.works/ibninglor/i-know).

### Public mint goes live July 7th at 7pm UTC.

## 2 Communities âš¡ï¸ 1 Vision

The more I learned about web3, the more I realized how valuable the developers in this space are and how little attention and recognition they receive. With this drop, I wanted to ensure that I not only gave back to my community IRL, but also to my online community, the devs and builders of web3.

### Developer DAO Partnership

* I am partnering with [Developer DAO](https://twitter.com/developer_dao) to help onboard more Chicago-based developers and communities of color into web3. To kick things off I will be giving away three Developer DAO membership NFTs to developers in Chicago who want to jump into web3. More updates and announcements on this partnership to come.

### Danger Zone DAO Scholarship

* 10% of the album proceeds, will go towards creating the [Danger Zone DAO](https://twitter.com/DangerZoneDAO) Scholarship Fund. The DAO will award two seniors from my alma mater computer science scholarships to study at any in-state university of their choice.
* Scholarship recipients will also be offered a paid internship with our DAO partners after their freshman year of college to gain hands-on, practical work experience along with mentorship from the awesome people at [Developer DAO](https://twitter.com/developer_dao).

## THANK YOU!

To **EVERYONE** involved in making this album a reality! This journey has been nothing short of amazing, and I am extremely grateful to be building here and receiving such tremendous support from everyone.

title: The role of communities in future economies. What are DAOs?
body:
From beginning of mankind, humans have tended to build communities in order to generate a common well-being, superior to that which can be achieved individually. Although most of human existence has been sustained by tribal societies of hunters and gatherers, development has taken place exponentially so that in the last hundreds of years we have gone through several socio-economic eras: agricultural, industrial and later the digital. Throughout this period, new systems of corporate governance have emerged at both the macro and micro levels, replacing outdated systems partially or even fully, thus creating more dynamic and agile communities.

**What are DAOs and how do they work?**

Although it may be difficult for us to imagine a different way of operating companies than the current hierarchical one, the emergence of a new concept, that of DAO, is very much embraced in the crypto world. Decentralized Autonomous Organization or DAO is a modern form of organizing online communities that have a common treasury offering the possibility for a group of people to align with a common goal. Decisions are taken following a vote on proposals made by any DAO participant. The way these decisions are carried out and the rules according to which the entity operates are enshrined in the smart contracts on the blockchain.

Of course, one of the questions that has arisen so far is how do you become a member of a decentralized organization? To become a member, you must own the governance token of the DAO and that gives you the right to vote. What is different from the voting systems we know today is that you can delegate your voting power to another member without transferring your tokens from your wallet.

And if at some point, the one to whom you empowered the voting power no longer represents your interests, you can undelegate your tokens and your voting right without having to wait until the "end of the term". A proposal that passes successfully will be carried out by the smart contract, which is transparent, open source and automatically activated, without going through the hands of a specific person or group with higher powers, which would make the process more difficult.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/KXQvAnAcyuBTK5otCnhne.jpg?height=682&width=1024)

**What benefits do this DAOs bring?**

But why not settle for a system that we already know and why would we need a DAO and what improvements would it bring? Being a native idea of web3 and blockchain, a DAO reduces centralization through its voting system. Each member has the right to vote on the proposals through the tokens he holds, and the share of the vote is equivalent to the number of those tokens.

Another advantage is that members of the organization can be located anywhere in the world without necessarily knowing each other and they can participate in the governance only through a simple internet connection.

One of the most important problems that DAOs can solve is that of the "principal agent." This problem arises in political and economic circles, in which the CEO or the Board of Directors (the agent) does not act in favor of the investors (the principal). In a DAO, a member is both the agent and the principal. Because the price of the token they hold is strongly linked to the success of the organization, each member will be driven to improve its reputation and contribute to its success.

Naturally, because it is a new concept and there are still many possible ways of improving these DAOs, they have the following disadvantages:

Being in an online environment, they are vulnerable to cyber attacks that can lead to token theft from the organization.

As we know, in order for democratic systems to work, members need to be active and to exercise their right to vote, and if that does not happen, the dynamics of the system will suffer as a result of difficult decision-making.

A very important aspect that can lead to either a plus or a minus of the DAO is the way the governing token is distributed, so that no majorities are formed that can influence the outcome of the vote for their own purpose. The fair distribution of tokens is called a fair launch.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/X5AY51A3HVxITkSFSCC1u.jpg?height=597&width=1024)

**How many types of DAOs are there and what are their purposes?**

The number of DAOs and their types is constantly increasing, so that DAOs with different purposes arose, and the main categories are as following:

**Investment DAOs** â€“ where people who are passionate about investing and who may not own large amounts of money, gather in the same place and together they can find the best investment opportunities that they may not have had access to, on their own. An example of this category is CityDAO.

**Collector DAOs** â€“ are those organizations that purchase collectibles and distribute ownership of various digital assets equally among all members of the community, as we can see in the case of PleasrDAO which owns some of the most outstanding NFTs.

**Protocol DAOs** â€“ are organizations that govern a protocol such as the case of Uniswap, in which holders of the UNI token have governance rights over the protocol and can vote for token allocation from the treasury for new partnerships or grants.

**Social DAOs** â€“ out of the desire of people who want to get together and socialize without being constrained by targeted ads, social media DAOs such as Blockster have also appeared.

**Entertainment DAOs** â€“ are the place where brilliant minds come together to give life to creative and exciting projects, such as what Bored Ape Yacht Club plan to do.

**What is StakeborgDAO?**

Simultaneously with the global trend, the first Romanian project, called StakeborgDAO, was launched, which set out to build a digital colony that will innovate, experiment and evolve. The foundation stone of StakeborgDAO's economy and governance is the STANDARD token, which has a limited supply of 20 million units and was distributed through a fair launch. This digital colony is differentiated by others through a competent team and constant transparent communication, which has also led to a high community involvement, with members investing both time and energy in developing and applying new ideas.

The first product developed by the team is based on index-type investment funds that have diversified crypto assets in their component to facilitate investments in this space for those whose time is limited.

The first two index funds launched are ILSI (Invest Like Stakeborg Index) and DAOX (The DAOX Index), to which more will be added in the near future. Details on these index funds can be found on the Â [www.stakeborgdao.com](http://www.stakeborgdao.com) platform, where you can also find the team's roadmap and whitepaper.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Sb5nrcPX177Wr4583YbTZ.png?height=406&width=717)

Since there is already quite a diversity in the number of DAOs, the answer to the question: which DAO could I be part of?, can come from everyone's desire to create solutions to certain existing problems or belonging to a group with common goals, and for this StakeborgDAO is an ideal place.

In short, decentralized autonomous organizations are a new form of cooperation between people that do not work on the basis of trust in a group of individuals, but are based on blockchain algorithms, and the future of these organizations is decided by each member.

In a study of the evolution of humanity, Edward O. Wilson showed that human nature developed over tens of thousands of years on 2 levels of selection: Individual, based on competition and cooperation between members of the same group, and on Group level, based on competition and cooperation between groups. The results show that within the group, selfish individuals outperform the selfless, but groups of altruists outperform groups of selfish individuals. This kind of attitude sums up the essence of the philosophy behind DAOs and tells us that these organizations, by their very essence, will define the world to come.

***One for all and all for DAO.***

![Album Cover by: Nate York](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/GeiNwQhI50ez9GF-ih2_7.png?height=3000&width=3000)

***An expressive, exhilarating ride of raw emotion.***

My seven-track album is a reflection of my world and upbringing.

1. Danger Zone
2. Jaw (feat. DuffleGang Gizzle)
3. Blinded by The Love
4. How Could I Ever (feat. Arran Sym)
5. Interlude
6. Talk Dirty (feat. Kevin Sinatra)
7. Family Matters (feat. Reef Loretto)

**Music Production by:** Arran Sym & Brandon Mahone

**Mastering by**: Collin Jordan

**Executive Produced by:** Danger Zone DAO

[crowdfund://0xAD1fE534cb1bEA44a67307164Da9C03b763815bE?features=backers](crowdfund://0xAD1fE534cb1bEA44a67307164Da9C03b763815bE?features=backers)

## Who, Where & Wen Mint?

[Danger Zone DAO](https://twitter.com/DangerZoneDAO) members, [Sound.xyz](https://www.sound.xyz/ibninglor), [Catalog](https://beta.catalog.works/ibninglor), and [Glass Protocol](https://glass.xyz/v/ZuoxqZRFDykGiGPNfgv_vnFbR8B0d2D-3pw2-lXbBns=) collectors holding their [Membership NFT cards](https://twitter.com/DangerZoneDAO/status/1537960671886749697?s=20&t=AA6PxuqMOpAGtMvqd4I9Cw) have received early access to preview the project [here!](https://ibninglor.xyz/dangerzone)

[https://twitter.com/DangerZoneDAO/status/1537960671886749697?s=20&t=AA6PxuqMOpAGtMvqd4I9Cw](https://twitter.com/DangerZoneDAO/status/1537960671886749697?s=20&t=AA6PxuqMOpAGtMvqd4I9Cw)

Pre-mint access can also be obtained by purchasing available Music NFTs on secondary via [Sound.xyz](https://opensea.io/collection/ibn-inglor) & [Catalog](https://beta.catalog.works/ibninglor/i-know).

### Public mint goes live July 7th at 7pm UTC.

## 2 Communities âš¡ï¸ 1 Vision

The more I learned about web3, the more I realized how valuable the developers in this space are and how little attention and recognition they receive. With this drop, I wanted to ensure that I not only gave back to my community IRL, but also to my online community, the devs and builders of web3.

### Developer DAO Partnership

* I am partnering with [Developer DAO](https://twitter.com/developer_dao) to help onboard more Chicago-based developers and communities of color into web3. To kick things off I will be giving away three Developer DAO membership NFTs to developers in Chicago who want to jump into web3. More updates and announcements on this partnership to come.

### Danger Zone DAO Scholarship

* 10% of the album proceeds, will go towards creating the [Danger Zone DAO](https://twitter.com/DangerZoneDAO) Scholarship Fund. The DAO will award two seniors from my alma mater computer science scholarships to study at any in-state university of their choice.
* Scholarship recipients will also be offered a paid internship with our DAO partners after their freshman year of college to gain hands-on, practical work experience along with mentorship from the awesome people at [Developer DAO](https://twitter.com/developer_dao).

## THANK YOU!

To **EVERYONE** involved in making this album a reality! This journey has been nothing short of amazing, and I am extremely grateful to be building here and receiving such tremendous support from everyone.

title: Ğne of the voices on the air
body:
## Efremov: My voice comes from the Black Hole.

I worked for many years in [Russian state propaganda](https://www.linkedin.com/in/dmitry-sergeevich-efremov/details/experience/). Some years ago I finally severed my ties with the Kremlin structures. It was a choice I had been making for many years. My choice is determined by my desire to live as alien. Not as russian. My muslim name is Khizr.

## My skills, experience and background:

* I have been a member of the Kremlin's youth movements since 2005. Deeply immersed in the specifics of marginalized movements - the Eurasian Youth Union and the National Bolshevik Front.
* The Russian Caucasus - from the creation of the North Caucasus Federal District under Khloponin and the long drift to the seizure of power by the Military (starting with the transition of Melikov in Dagestan).
* Own network of experts throughout the Caucasus region.
* Deep dive into Chechen society, connected with economic block persons, Islamic theologians, geographical and historical communities.
* Deep dive into building Kremlin networks on Telegram.
* Since 2020 - doing micro-investments in cryptocurrencies and web3 related infrastructure projects.

## Specifically:

* I'm not looking for a job.
* I'm not looking for a buyer.
* I want to eradicate slavery throughout Eurasia.
* If you want my experience or advice, contact me.
* No! I will never go into the square with a placard, because now I don't believe in soft power.
* I believe in sovereignty, of which I am the source, and my right to delegate it or demand it back is sacred. Take as much sovereignty as you wish.
* Russia is nothing.
  But Russia is also a prison of nations. The walls of the prison will collapse. 
 But the guards will remain.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Ab2HT3spkxPlGB8hrEbbC.jpeg?height=600&width=600)

I'm also maked a #koklomapedia project with a few friends. You can find out what it is from the book in the attachment to the NFT at the link down

[https://www.mintbase.io/thing/rYBpN7RyDt8E8HJlW7oOhLOhnOIrrcZruwQJVs8q7MY:radioevrazia.mintbase1.near](https://www.mintbase.io/thing/rYBpN7RyDt8E8HJlW7oOhLOhnOIrrcZruwQJVs8q7MY:radioevrazia.mintbase1.near)

body:
> *â€œWeb3â€™s most anticipated projectâ€ - The community*

The first project to come out of the [Danger Zone DAO](https://twitter.com/DangerZoneDAO) will be the â€œDanger Zoneâ€ EP and we couldnâ€™t be happier. Without the support of the community, the [crowdfund](https://ibn.mirror.xyz/crowdfunds/0xAD1fE534cb1bEA44a67307164Da9C03b763815bE) backers and many others we wouldnâ€™t be here today.

*For those who donâ€™t knowâ€¦*

### I AM

### IBN INGLOR

![FWB x ZORA - SXSW '22 Performance | Photography by Angel Darmella Eâ€™Stash](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/vNcchoICiMyN_0OxpdF9d.JPG?height=1152&width=2048)

Born and raised on Chicagoâ€™s far Southside, Iâ€™m an alternative hip-hop artist who is making major waves in Web3. I was able to raise 20 ETH through Mirror's crowdfunding tool, which I used to fund the first [Danger Zone DAO](https://twitter.com/DangerZoneDAO) project, "Danger Zone EP", as well as start one of the first creator DAOs. In addition, I was the first Hip-Hop artist to release music on [Sound.xyz](https://www.sound.xyz/ibninglor), and Iâ€™ve grown from being the artist who was *"[too ambitious without enough support](https://twitter.com/IbnInglor/status/1452444679895670785?s=20&t=NfU3XolWJjr9XCusG5mnTQ)"* to building a whole community of believers.

Prior to web3, Iâ€™ve released projects that garnered attention from major publications. My distinctive sound as well as my dedication to exploring original ideas had my earlier releases featured in [The FADER Magazine](https://www.thefader.com/artist/ibn-inglor), [Hypebeast](https://hypebeast.com/tags/ibn-inglor), [Noisey](https://www.vice.com/en/article/rq4a3w/premiere-chicago-rapper-ibn-inglor-fights-back-depression-with-pray-for-health), and had me listed in [Complexâ€™s annual â€œ25 New Rappers to Watch Out Forâ€](https://www.complex.com/music/2013/07/25-new-rappers-to-watch-out-for/ibn-inglor?utm_campaign=complexmag+socialflow+07+2013&utm_source=twitter&utm_medium=social). My latest project is a symbol of hope to the children of Chicago's most violent neighborhoods, while also offering a theatrical experience to the listeners.

## Posted on May 10 (second post)

I stretched out on the sofa, the laptop resting on my stomach. I scrolled through William's final items. They were elaborate, once again describing the details of his abundant life. The items described the lemon smell of a motel room, roaming the city streets, stopping to admire the architecture of a church, smelling the strawberries in Kensington Market.

I fought the feeling of endlessness, reading through the afternoon, aiming only to finish. I pushed through the third last item, the second last item, and then finally I was back again at the very last item I had read first, days ago.

*7:7*

*Iâ€™m sitting two table away from him. His eyes are as deep as I imagined. I challenge him to remember a phrase. Letâ€™s see if he does.*

A cold breeze entered through the open window, and once again, I felt empty. So I scrolled back through Williamâ€™s collection and started reading again from the beginning.


---

title: Blockchains are fundamentally a way to create economies through code
body:
Few fields have been impacted more by the term "blockchain" than economics.

Through complicated algorithms, the capacity to design new monetary policies and distribute and allot these tokens based on economic incentives has led to the emergence of new types of trade and economies.

Blockchains, in my opinion, are basically a means of creating economies through code. The computational infrastructure behind this economic laboratory is being created today.

Cryptography is used to safeguard the ledger on which cryptocurrency transactions are recorded, and cryptography and distributed (consensus) procedures are used to establish confidence among participants.

We can anticipate Blockchains to enable new types of economic networks, just as the Internet permitted new forms of social networks.

Computer scientists will not just construct this technology, but will also ideally engage with economists to design and study these bootstrapped economies.

As this economic laboratory, a Decentralized Ledger, grows and tokenomists experiment with new economic models, we will recognize blockchain for what they truly are: an economic laboratory fostering ongoing progress and innovation.

title: Posted on May 11
body:

**[The previous - 23. Posted on May 10 (second post)](https://mirror.xyz/everyoneandnoone.eth/PK-Z_dz4L23EhDYDqXg5oYmNznGTcIg5yBUBlDQ1Udo)**

## Posted on May 11

I felt a drop of rain on my wrist and another on my lip. I walked faster down the row of townhouses heading to Leah's place. It was almost noon and the darkening clouds looked the way clouds look before it pours.

Focusing ahead, I walked faster. I hadnâ€™t slept for two days. Once again, I was obsessed with the online, and I lost everything I had gained with Leah.

Reaching Leah's place, I banged on the door louder than I had intended and was worried the neighbor upstairs might be alarmed. Waiting a moment, I knocked again, this time softer. A minute passed. She wasn't home, I thought. I sat on her doorstep under an eave and lit a smoke. Looking up at the moving clouds, there was no doubt it would pourâ€”but when? Then distant thunder rumbled and rain fell hard, drumming on the eave above. On my third cigarette, the pouring stopped as quickly as it came, leaving behind globs of raindrops hanging from the edge of the roof.

Then I heard someone behind Leah's door and quickly stood up.

The door opened and Leah, holding a long umbrella, looked at me, surprised. I expected her to say something, but instead, she looked at me curiously, waiting for me to say something first.

"You're home," I said.

"How long...long were you out here?" she stammered.

"You didn't hear me knock?"

"I was in the shower."

"Oh, not too long.â€

"I'm going toâ€¦get some bread," she stepped into me, forcing me to step back, and locked the door behind her. Â 

I followed her down the sidewalk, offering to hold her umbrella, but she refused. We hardly said a word all the way to the store.

Walking back home, the thinning clouds above exposed patches of blue. I carried her plastic grocery bag holding two loaves of white bread. We passed the swimming pool and tennis courts before arriving back at her place. She walked in leaving the door open behind her, an invite to come inside, I thought.

In her kitchen, she put a kettle on the stove and gave me a saucer for an ashtray.

"Thanks," I sat down at the table.

Waiting for the kettle to boil, she lit an incense stick and waved her hand through the smoke in a scooping motion towards her face. "I don't...understand," she said, opening a cupboard and pulling out a box of oatmeal cookies. I pinched out a cigarette from my pack. She was acting distant, and I didn't blame her.

She dropped a small plate of cookies on the table, a spark of attitude in her eyes. It surprised me.Â 

She sat down and glared at me. "What...do you want?"

"What do you mean?" I said, worried about saying something wrong.

"I mean...you just have to tell me. You don't have to play games," she said.

"Is that what you think?"

"Then what is it?"

I put the cigarette back into the pack and stared at the table for a long time.

"Well?" she said.

"There's..." I stuttered, careful with my words. "I know you want me to be more open with you, and I know I haven't been doing that. But, I'm ready to do that now."

She held her stare. "I have nothingâ€¦to hide from you. I...I deserve the same, don't I?"

"You do. And that's why I'm going to tell you something I've never told anyone, okay?" I shook my head. "It's just that..." I paused.

"What?"

"If I tell you, I'm afraid you might leave me."

"I won't...leave you that easily. Now have a cookie."

"I'm not hungry," I said.

"Have oneâ€¦anyway,â€ she pushed the plate closer.

"Okay," I said, taking a cookie. I was sick of the secrets anyway. I crunched down, swallowed, and braced myself. "I'm on medication. I mean, I was."

"What medication?"

"It's hard to explain," I said. The look on her face softened. "I can't remember when the problem started."

The kettle burbled and then wheezed.

"Shoot," she jumped. "Hold your thought. I want...I want to give you my full attention." She opened the cupboard as the wheezing turned into whistling. She poured the boiling water into two cups in such a rush that I was worried she might burn herself. Sitting back down, she added a teabag to each cup, placed one in front of me, and I suddenly felt like changing the subject. But it was too late for that. So I just said it.

"When I was seven, my fatherâ€”he killed my mother. And then he killed himself," I paused and then pushed on. "I donâ€™t remember much of what happened, really. But I remember growing up and thinking I was different. Not like other kids. I just didnâ€™t feeling anything."

Leah's eyes saddened.

"I felt numb. No, not numb," I said. "I felt nothing. For a long time."

"Howâ€¦are you feeling now?"

"When I'm with you? I don't feel that way at all," I said. She reached her hands out to me. The incense on the table was almost burnt out, a long line of ash threatening to break. She bent low in her chair, her elbows touching her knees, and her head tilted up towards mine. The rain started up again, pattering on the windows. Then suddenly, the consecutive days of no sleep took its toll and pulled at my arms and eyelids like led. I was very sleepy, and very happy to be feeling anything at all. There was so much more I needed to tell her. I had to tell her about Williamâ€”about his writing. But I was so sleepy, and Leah was mine again.

"Let's takeâ€¦a nap?" she pulled me passed her elliptical, the hanging cross on the wall, and into her purple bedroom. We undressed to our underwear. I felt her body slide under the covers next to me. I indulged in the softness of her legs and cotton t-shirt.

"Now, I have a secret...to tell you," she breathed, putting her leg on top of mine, pressing her face into my shoulder, smelling me deeply. "Before I went on meds, I tried to...kill myself. I needed an escape from the anxiety. There was just no comfort...or pleasure...hour after hour, day after day. No one could...could explain it to me. I was so scared of it, and the more I feared it, the...the stronger it got.

"So one night, I swallowed an entire bottle of Tylenol, and woke...woke up in a hospital bed. It...it was there, when I walked to the chapel in the morning. I stood under a large painting of the Lord. In the painting, there were...lights of different colors...shooting from his heart. And there were words written by his feet that said *'Trust in God'*.

"At that...that moment, I just gave up, giving all my will power to God, and let the anxiety happen. And with that...the anxiety flowed out of me...and onto the floor. I had been fighting the anxiety for so long, but when I finally decided to accept it, it...it went away. I decided right there and then that my will was not my own, but that it was God's will. I learned to let go of everything. I still...still take meds every day, but at least I can say I'm okay now. I can say that now...I'm okay."

I kissed her forehead. "We're a couple of weirdos, aren't we?"

Leah smiled and closed her eyes. "Can you rub my back?" She flipped over onto her stomach. I slid my hand up the back of her shirt and massaged her shoulder blades, slowly, lightly, for several minutes, until I heard the gentle rasping of her sleeping breath.


---

Continued on **Posted on May 12** dropping next noon.

title: Earning without learning
body:
If could go back in time for 18 months its easy to think that i would be incredibly rich. Why wouldnt i? Long your BTC all the way up to 62k and short there. Take your profits on 30k and start 100x longs at 29-30k. How EASY! Then dump all these somewhere around 67-69k (so big position cannot be dumped at market sell right?) Ok next? Start shorting at these prices aaaalll the way down to 19k. Well, if one started this strategy with 1000$ when BTC was 18k this would roughly return 500 millions USD or something. Man, how easy. 

Truth is there is no such thing. The reason i wrote it up there was because from time to time when i look at charts to see my next in or out levels i often find myself dreaming about this. Despite not doing any of that i found myself in a profitable position at April 2021, my profits were huge. But then 19 May 2021 came and i saw the truth of money markets. But wasnt awake still. Even though i was at great loss i hodl my positions (both in margin and spot) and lived through it. Fall 2021 was profitable as well so i wasnt interested in learning trading. Still after 7 September 2021 i understood that i shouldnt be exposed to my long positions that much, so got my margins smaller in time. December 2021 didnt hit me that much, i wasnt exposed to volatility that much. After Dec 2021 i understood that i needed to learn some stuff about technical analysis. So came my Price Action story. 

After that what i live was interesting. Much i learned, less i earned. Much i learned, less i earned. Strange isnt it? No, i was in control of my losses. I wasnt exposed to market downs. So even though i was earning less the most important thing was happening, i wasnt losing much. All my losses were in my control (expect one event im going to explain). So the real story should start here. 

If i could go back in time for 18 months it wouldnt be easy to get rich. But i wouldnt be losing. I wouldnt be exposed to margin calls or sth but what profit i make during this bull run would be kept in my pocket. Thats the truth that makes a trader to live through market ups and downs. You should know where to stop. Many will never learn this in these markets. Those who doesnt learn are our liquidty. I was liquidity as well, someone else took my money if im to explain in a simple way. Now, those who are not interested in learning will be my liquidty. Thats what matters in that market. Some should lose so others could earn. 

By the way, that event was UST/Luna crush. Most of my portfolio was on UST (roughly 60%) and that hit me incredibly hard. All the profits i make are gone and im even at loss from my starting capital. Shit happens right?

title: Danger Zone EP âš¡ï¸ Drops 7/7  @ 7PM UTC
body:
> *â€œWeb3â€™s most anticipated projectâ€ - The community*

The first project to come out of the [Danger Zone DAO](https://twitter.com/DangerZoneDAO) will be the â€œDanger Zoneâ€ EP and we couldnâ€™t be happier. Without the support of the community, the [crowdfund](https://ibn.mirror.xyz/crowdfunds/0xAD1fE534cb1bEA44a67307164Da9C03b763815bE) backers and many others we wouldnâ€™t be here today.

*For those who donâ€™t knowâ€¦*

### I AM

### IBN INGLOR

![FWB x ZORA - SXSW '22 Performance | Photography by Angel Darmella Eâ€™Stash](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/vNcchoICiMyN_0OxpdF9d.JPG?height=1152&width=2048)

Born and raised on Chicagoâ€™s far Southside, Iâ€™m an alternative hip-hop artist who is making major waves in Web3. I was able to raise 20 ETH through Mirror's crowdfunding tool, which I used to fund the first [Danger Zone DAO](https://twitter.com/DangerZoneDAO) project, "Danger Zone EP", as well as start one of the first creator DAOs. In addition, I was the first Hip-Hop artist to release music on [Sound.xyz](https://www.sound.xyz/ibninglor), and Iâ€™ve grown from being the artist who was *"[too ambitious without enough support](https://twitter.com/IbnInglor/status/1452444679895670785?s=20&t=NfU3XolWJjr9XCusG5mnTQ)"* to building a whole community of believers.

Prior to web3, Iâ€™ve released projects that garnered attention from major publications. My distinctive sound as well as my dedication to exploring original ideas had my earlier releases featured in [The FADER Magazine](https://www.thefader.com/artist/ibn-inglor), [Hypebeast](https://hypebeast.com/tags/ibn-inglor), [Noisey](https://www.vice.com/en/article/rq4a3w/premiere-chicago-rapper-ibn-inglor-fights-back-depression-with-pray-for-health), and had me listed in [Complexâ€™s annual â€œ25 New Rappers to Watch Out Forâ€](https://www.complex.com/music/2013/07/25-new-rappers-to-watch-out-for/ibn-inglor?utm_campaign=complexmag+socialflow+07+2013&utm_source=twitter&utm_medium=social). My latest project is a symbol of hope to the children of Chicago's most violent neighborhoods, while also offering a theatrical experience to the listeners.

## DANGER ZONE: The Album

***An expressive, exhilarating ride of raw emotion.***

## Who, Where & Wen Mint?

[Danger Zone DAO](https://twitter.com/DangerZoneDAO) members, [Sound.xyz](https://www.sound.xyz/ibninglor), [Catalog](https://beta.catalog.works/ibninglor), and [Glass Protocol](https://glass.xyz/v/ZuoxqZRFDykGiGPNfgv_vnFbR8B0d2D-3pw2-lXbBns=) collectors holding their [Membership NFT cards](https://twitter.com/DangerZoneDAO/status/1537960671886749697?s=20&t=AA6PxuqMOpAGtMvqd4I9Cw) have received early access to preview the project [here!](https://ibninglor.xyz/dangerzone)

[https://twitter.com/DangerZoneDAO/status/1537960671886749697?s=20&t=AA6PxuqMOpAGtMvqd4I9Cw](https://twitter.com/DangerZoneDAO/status/1537960671886749697?s=20&t=AA6PxuqMOpAGtMvqd4I9Cw)

Pre-mint access can also be obtained by purchasing available Music NFTs on secondary via [Sound.xyz](https://opensea.io/collection/ibn-inglor) & [Catalog](https://beta.catalog.works/ibninglor/i-know).

### Public mint goes live July 7th at 7pm UTC.

## 2 Communities âš¡ï¸ 1 Vision

The more I learned about web3, the more I realized how valuable the developers in this space are and how little attention and recognition they receive. With this drop, I wanted to ensure that I not only gave back to my community IRL, but also to my online community, the devs and builders of web3.

### Developer DAO Partnership

* I am partnering with [Developer DAO](https://twitter.com/developer_dao) to help onboard more Chicago-based developers and communities of color into web3. To kick things off I will be giving away three Developer DAO membership NFTs to developers in Chicago who want to jump into web3. More updates and announcements on this partnership to come.

### Danger Zone DAO Scholarship

* 10% of the album proceeds, will go towards creating the [Danger Zone DAO](https://twitter.com/DangerZoneDAO) Scholarship Fund. The DAO will award two seniors from my alma mater computer science scholarships to study at any in-state university of their choice.
* Scholarship recipients will also be offered a paid internship with our DAO partners after their freshman year of college to gain hands-on, practical work experience along with mentorship from the awesome people at [Developer DAO](https://twitter.com/developer_dao).

## THANK YOU!

To **EVERYONE** involved in making this album a reality! This journey has been nothing short of amazing, and I am extremely grateful to be building here and receiving such tremendous support from everyone.

title: Cultural Interaction Simulations: Web3 and Blockchain
body:
Culture; In its most general definition, it is a general name given to all kinds of values created in the historical and social process. It can be said that all of the beings created by the thought and consensus of a society. Into these assets and values; management styles, economic structures, educational processes and the most concrete example, art. 
  
 Cultural and artistic accumulation is shaped as a result of our past experiences. Most of the universally accepted works of art were created after great suffering, disasters and wars in human history.  
  
 *The collapse of Rome had long repercussions in a period of close to a thousand years, and the Renaissance emerged as a result of a process ranging from the crusades to the plague, from famine to invasion. For instance, Delaxroix painted "Liberty Leading the People" after more than 1 million people died in France. In the Spanish Civil War, the Nazis killed 600,000 people so Picasso could draw Guernica. Salvador Dali started painting after the effects of World War I and saw World War II. Nearly 100 million people died in the wars he saw. The surrealism in his paintings was an escape from all these massacres. Francisco Goya painted the paintings â€œMay 2, 1808â€ and â€œMay 3, 1808â€ in memory of the Spaniards who resisted Napoleon's armies during the French occupation of Madrid in 1808. Approximately 500 people died in this uprising.* 
  
 **But now it is possible to progress culturally without experiencing these painful experiences, because technological developments have turned these facts and concepts into a digital simulation. The only thing that makes this simulation real and possible is the blockchain itself. In fact, it would not be an exaggeration to say that blockchain is the today proven version of what was imagined in the past.** 
  
 As a process, although we thought that "Modernity" expanded the areas of freedom in individual, social and political areas of life, we actually ignored the problems in these areas and continued on our way as humanity. We tried to cover all of the financial crises, transparent and unfair public administrations and central authorities, but as the snowball turned into an avalanche, this has become an inevitable and unmanageable big problem over time. 
  
 *And thus, human history built the 250 years after the Industrial Revolution as an unsustainable and consumption-oriented structure with no future.* 
  
 We felt the need to create a new space for ourselves with the experiences we had from our cultural backgrounds in this area where social freedom disappeared and areas of individual freedom began to disappear. While creating this space, we decided to build structures where financial crises, transparent and unfair public administration and central authorities that restrict freedoms are not sheltered. Of course, we did this in a modern and technological way. The basis for the emergence of the blockchain was the existence of these problems. 
  
 Although it did not arise directly by targeting these problems, the freedom and desire to realize our ideas in our subconscious has brought some of the 8 billion population towards this field at every step. When the books written, academic publications, technological developments, the Internet and the economy were brought together, we started to decentralize finance. 
  
 Here, let's compare the central authority and the cryptocurrency ecosystem to see how the change makes a difference. Imagine that ten years ago you physically printed your own dollar in America and used it in many places, you would probably have received one of the harshest sentences in the constitution and you could even be executed under some state laws. 
  
 But now we can create our own economy and community for an idea or space of our own dreams. In short, cryptocurrencies have not only brought finance together with the internet and decentralized it, but also liberated it. Saving finance from centralized structures increased not only individual but also social welfare. The rise in the value of cryptocurrencies caused users to dream of a better world instead of more money and take steps to realize it. Of course it's for a very small minority (see: Gitcoin Grants) 
  
 "I want to make our world more like Yudkowski's "Dath Ilan" utopia, where wealthy people go to support public goods instead of their wealth signs turning into wasteful, zero-sum nonsense," Vitalik said recently to support projects featured on Gitcoin Grant.  
  
 In fact, the point he's talking about here is that he clearly states that personal wealth will not help us change the world the way we want. The abundance of public wealth creates an improved level of social well-being rather than income inequality as in personal wealth. Everyone is free and equal to use that resource. In other words, a social structure is created in which everyone is rich in meeting their needs. A social structure built and enriched by knowledge, without economic tyranny such as monopolizing money. 
  
 In fact, the biggest problem is a domino structure created by the global and traditional economy itself, in which all chains do not need each other but are in need. With a simple example; If inflation occurs, purchasing power decreases and prices rise. If prices go up, people start to avoid spending money psychologically and do not spend money other than their basic needs, and culture and art are actually directly affected, not indirectly. The development of blockchain has caused and will continue to cause changes not only in financial terms, but also in the fields of public administration, production models, education and arts. 
  
 Because one of the most important elements of Blockchain networks is the consensus mechanism. A consensus mechanism is the way stakeholders validate and secure shared data in a decentralized network. Reconciliation must be achieved so that the blockchain network can verify a transaction and move on to new transactions. For example, let's imagine we vote on the blockchain and if the politicians don't do what they say, we withdraw our votes or start a new vote. When institutions that are not transparent in public administration move to the blockchain, they will be more fair thanks to the transparency of the blockchain. This is possible with Delegated Proof of Stake (DPos). Here is the purely true Athenian Democracy, for eight billion people. 
  
 Using blockchain in scientific and academic sense has solutions that will save our education models from these blind structures. Open sources and databases provide a fairer education opportunity for all. Acquiring all these possibilities is less costly or free of charge than traditional buildings. 
  
 In terms of art, I think it would be more beneficial to build on the blockchain instead of talking about it too much. There are no traditional institutions, it provides a direct and direct cultural interaction without intermediaries. Blockchain is a resolution mechanism that removes obstacles. Moreover, thanks to digital wallets and identities, the space for movement desired by artists is created. No censorship or restrictions. No one is asking you about your religion, nationality or gender. There is no homophobia or racism. Just concentrate on your art. 
  
 Regardless of the identity, gender and faith of the eight billion people, blockchains are the fastest and safest way to build Athens city democracy. We have only just begun to untie the knot. While more than half of the world is using the internet, it would be best to search for the solution on the internet. In order to carry the freedom, equality and the ideal of humanity to the future with a solution-oriented approach, we must transfer all of our motivation and experience to this field, along with life itself. 
  
  
 **De-Fi** (Decentralized Finance) in economics and finance

**DAO, DPos**(Delegated Proof of Stake) in the fields of Management, Consensus, Consensus

In the field of Culture and Arts, **NFT, F-NFT**

In the field of Education, **OpenSources, Databases**, and this list could go on almost hundreds of lines. 
  
 And this list could go on by hundreds of lines.

Human history has made its first and greatest leap through cultural interactions based on geographical discoveries. The second big leap is; It will be thanks to blockchains, open sources and databases. Because this too the interaction form of the digital culture of humanity. 
  
 Art Historian 
 [Ogulcan Yildirim](https://twitter.com/ogulcanyildirm)

title: The Strangest Level
body:
![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/8w7dru6ubmlyrMSO0A02i.png?height=481&width=720)

The cabin in the woods had been abandoned for years, but one night, a candle burned in the window. It was a very odd phenomenon to say the least... there had been no activity from the cabin or the woods in this level that we have documented before. Everything about this level in the database says that, other than the fact there is a random cabin, few other landmarks, a forest that only expands about thirty square miles with this particular house dead center, there was seemingly nothing anomalous about this area and could be seen as one of the safest levels here in the Backrooms... a place where you could go, rest around the forest or in the abandoned cabin, and safely rest for the night knowing the worse that could happen to you was that you might get an unexpected splinter if you touch the outside wooden wall of the house for too long.

The Backrooms was a really strange place to be - a glitch in reality that seemed to swallow up people at random & send them to a strange realm in time and space. You could be walking on the beach one day and randomly fall through the ground before ending up in this strange realm outside of known existence. You could be vacating in the Rocky mountains before slipping through the ground and ending up in a massive 'room' with similar looking mountains with strange, otherworldly properties. People have been falling into the Backrooms in random, isolated incidents with no chance of getting back to Earth or their regular life afterwards. On top of that, many regions of the Backrooms are filled with monsters and horrors that may try to kill any human that happens to cross their path or attempt to twist the mind of anyone unlucky enough to end up in their grasp or subject people to a terrible eternal fate. It is tough to survive in the Backrooms once you end up here. It is filled with various different 'rooms' you can travel to, but each of them are run by strange laws of physics and existence & there is no warning as to how safe or dangerous each room is going to be. If you leave the current room you are sitting in, you could either end up in a room that is so safe that you could settle down there or so dangerous it could tear you to shreds in seconds. Honestly, travelling through these rooms - traversing this place - is basically a game of chance with the highest stakes possible.

The safe rooms that people have been able to find are a great reprieve from this guessing game, such as the room I described at the beginning of this log with a cabin. It seemed like a peaceful place to rest and there were no signs of any monsters, eldritch creatures, or psychotic beings there. It seemed safe. Yet, when a small group of people from my colony recently went there to check, their tales of what happened when they visited the cabin seem to prove our original assumptions wrong. A small group of six visited the room and after moving through the woods, saw a light emanating from one of the windows on the cabin. This small gang of three guys and three girls, decided they needed to explore and see if the candle was a sign that someone had decided to set up camp in the abandoned building. As they got closer to the broken house, two of the members of this group - a girl named Amy and one named Benjamin- decided to stay back because she felt 'uneasy' about going inside. Apparently, her brother named Johnathan went into the cabin by himself to see if he could make out what might have been going on inside of the debilitated house. As he entered, the candle light suddenly got brighter and brighter and brighter. It got so bright that Amy and those looking at the cabin suffered from a period of brief blindness. When the blindness wore off, the light from the cabin had dimmed back to that of a small candle and something emerged from the cabin...

This 'thing' was a creature that Amy barely had any time to look at for too long before it started to attack her and the others who came to the 'room'. However, from what she could see, the 'thing' was a monster with a long, slick black body similar to a 'tube' of darkness. From this tube was a thin head covered by several eyes & a single mouth containing several sharp teeth. Each tooth was about a few inches long with each one being easily long enough to rip through flesh and bone. When it came out of the cabin, it looked back and forth for a few seconds before eyeing the group & attacking. We only know what happened because Amy and Benjamin came back with their lives and were able to describe the incident to us. Benjamin was even able to take a few pictures with a camera he had brought along and a single two-inch long tooth-like protrusion that could be found on his leg.

So far, other than the testimony of these two and what I have put down in this log, we have no other information about what happened during this strange event. We do not know if this creature was already inside of the cabin or if some event related to the bright light that briefly came from the cabin produced this creature in some way. We do not know if the creature consumed Johnathan or if Johnathan is now somehow a part of this new monster. We currently do not understand why something like this has not happened before and why, only happened may years of this room and cabin seeming safe, that something like this occurred. Was this always destined to happen in this room or was this some kind of freak once -in-a-lifetime occurrence? We don't know but hopefully, we might be able to get more answers in the near future...

title: What's WakeUp?
body:
*An introduction to the project that aims to provide NFT infrastructure.*

By [0xMilton](https://twitter.com/0xMilton).

WakeUp is an organization that believes in **decentralization as a technological and social paradigm,** and in empowering people to gain their sovereignty in all their digital interactions by removing unnecessary intermediaries and barriers.

We believe in the web3 ethos, started with Bitcoin, continued by Ethereum and then by many other blockchains.

![WakeUp](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/0WmVVX_TLojsODbHecKG6.jpg?height=2627&width=5001)

Weâ€™ve seen blockchain technology thrive, first with cryptocurrencies and as a store of value, *then with the democratization of access to financial services with DeFi, and last year (2021) with the technology that will define property rights for the upcom*ing era: NFT (non-fungible tokens).


---

Due to the permissionless and composability features offered by web3, we can all build and add new Lego bricks to a single collaborative construction. For instance, this year more and more Lego bricks will be added on top of the NFT base blocks that were set up last year.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/sdkCWsEvYj8FIgZ1ZKk_o.jpg?height=2627&width=5001)

We are sure that NFTs are not just pfp (profile pictures) or beautiful jpegs. NFT**s** are as simple and as complex to define who is the owner of a specific asset in the entire universe, both physical and digital (aka â€œmetaverseâ€). Whether itâ€™s a digital artwork, a metaverse land, a video game or a physical world asset; in a decentralized, intermediary-less, trustless, and open way.


---

In WakeUp we are building products and solutions that add more utility to the NFTs, also that enhance the NFT experience for users and lower the complexity for devs of NFT dapps, protocols, services, games, collections, among others. And we are doing it by working side by side with them all, staying focused on their real needs.

NFT adoption growth will be immense in the upcoming years, and the infrastructure is still not ready to bring next level of NFTs & platforms to life. We aim to support that growth, but we also want to be part of this innovation.


---

Soon more updates about WakeUp, stay tuned!

Thanks for reading.

*Follow us on [Twitter](https://bit.ly/WakeUp_twitter) and [Linkedin.](https://bit.ly/WakeUp_Linkedin)*

title: WakeUp protocol: an On-Chain mechanism to DelegateÂ NFTs
body:
*Utility NFTsâ€™ adoption growth needs to go along with the proper infrastructure.*

*By [0xMilton](https://twitter.com/0xMilton).*

At WakeUp, we found a problem worth solving for utility NFTs (*those that can be used for more than just a profile pictureâ€Šâ€”â€Š [see more](https://mirror.xyz/0x9dFa9dfD15d2b2fa9717b4fc545c2bB35a29215c/CgM_gQHKsPsmfzVAybc_le3-uugvyfCvECFYx-LlJXA)*): they still lack the right tools to reach their full potential in a cost-effective, interoperable, and decentralized way.

Our first big goal, that aims to solve this problem, is to offer to the NFT ecosystem **an On-Chain mechanism to Delegate NFTs** simply and securely. We are building the infrastructure that will help to bring this functionality to life by extending the NFT standardâ€™s current capabilities.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/V3jUCfXDgnlVnBs8W8P4e.jpg?height=2626&width=5001)

We are developing an **NFT delegation protocol** that will help users delegate their NFTs and, optionally, get a passive income for that, always keeping in mind that the NFT will not leave the ownerâ€™s wallet, ever.

And there is no simple, not even a native/standard way to do this.

Some platforms offer marketplaces to delegate via rental against crypto as collateral. Some others provide to lend copies of the original NFT (namely, â€œwrapped NFTsâ€). These have different issues. In the former, nobody guarantees you that the NFT will be returned to you, and in the latter, you have nothing to do with the original NFT. You just hold a copy of it.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/qg7yhoJVYXxtZj96uk477.jpg?height=675&width=762)

WakeUp Delegation protocol supports new Ethereum Improvement Proposals (EIPs) (willing to become ERC standards) to enable native delegation features for NFTs. The actual NFT owner wonâ€™t risk losing the NFT, while the other part will be recognized as the only â€œtenantâ€ of the actual NFT (and not a copy of it), being the beneficiary of all the benefits the NFT brings with it when renting it.

So, letâ€™s imagine that you have an NFT annual pass for a series of events or concerts (it could be on the metaverse or in real life). And for some reason, you canâ€™t attend some of them. You will be able to delegate your NFT event pass to someone by using WakeUp protocol. This new user will have the right to attend these events that you canâ€™t go to; meanwhile, the NFT will be in your wallet all the time, and the usage rights will return to you once the delegation time is over. At this point, you will be able to use your NFT annual pass again.


---

The essential part of all this is that every delegable NFT will be ERC721 compatible to be used on any platform or marketplace out there without any friction.

WakeUp Delegation protocol **enables new revenue streams** for NFT projects and holders while **lowering at the same time barriers to access** for less wealthy people, thus, promoting massive growth in active users.

In future articles, we will get deeper into how the protocol works and how it economically incentivizes the different actors to participate and make it smooth for NFT owners and renters.


---

**We envision a multi-chain future** and our ethos is composability and interoperability, so everything we build will be backward compatible and will promote new community standards *([more about whatâ€™s WakeUp, here](https://mirror.xyz/0x9dFa9dfD15d2b2fa9717b4fc545c2bB35a29215c/5zOPnDQBgKv-btMlf-x6EU-aGLnbNtMSHB8gHkwotLs)).*

NFT Projects will be able to rely on WakeUp to avoid incurring extra development costs to create and maintain ad-hoc solutions by integrating our protocol in a seamless way.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/c_H2fvvcJji5LannnsYFF.jpg?height=2627&width=5001)

Are you interested in integrating WakeUp into your NFT Project?
Please contact us in:

ğŸ¦ **[Twitter](https://bit.ly/Twitter_WakeUp)**
ğŸ”· **[LinkedIn](https://bit.ly/Linkedin_WakeUp)**
ğŸŒ **[Website](https://bit.ly/Site_WakeUp)**

Thanks for reading!

title: The Backrooms Creepypasta
body:
![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/WNWd15S6VuZ59VqRWQf2Y.png?height=540&width=720)

People might not enjoy the average internet creepypasta and find it to simply be annoying and cliche. While I can agree that most creepypastas and internet horrors are pretty subpar, I have a bit of a soft spot for many of the good ones. To me, creepypastas are basically the campfire spooky stories of the modern age and they are great ways for children and adults to scare themselves and others. I personally do not want to ruin the fun of the new horror writers of the world who are getting their start creating creepypastas so they can spread their creative wings someday and write something much better. Even as an adult, some internet scary stories can still give me chills.

The SCP Foundation, for example, is a pretty good example of a good internet creepypasta. It is about a series of secret organizations, including the SCP Foundation, who contain eldritch objects and horrors in order to protect mankind. Some of these objects are safe, but many of them are incredibly dangerous to the point where they can destroy innocent lives or eliminate entire communities. Some of the eldritch beings the Foundation and its allies contain can potentially end the entire globe if they were ever released, so the Foundation has to work hard and make sacrifices to ensure that mankind will make it to see tomorrow. These stories can contain some pretty gripping stuff that can even rival some of the works of writers like Stephen King (a man who is one of my favorite authors due to my love of the horror genre). There are plenty of creepy objects the SCP Foundation Wiki describes such as a statute that if you turn your back on it for too long can snap your neck, a series of items that can teleport you to other dimensions if handled improperly, and even entries that describe those who run the SCP Foundation as not necessarily being entirely human themselves. If you want to read some of the stories made about the SCP Foundation, you can visit their wiki here: www.scpwiki.com.

However, there is a new creepypasta that I find to be very enjoyable. It is based around the idea that reality itself might be a simulation. In video games, there are glitches called no-clipping where if you go to a certain region of a game, you could find your player character teleporting out of the game world and ending up in an uncoded region of the game that you were not supposed to end up in. Well, the creepypasta known as â€˜The Backroomsâ€™ states that you can accidentally â€˜no-clipâ€™ out of reality and end up in another reality known as the â€˜Backroomsâ€™. This reality is made up of a series of seemingly infinite â€˜roomsâ€™ with each room varying in size. Some are infinite in size, other rooms are only a few square meters. Some of these rooms are safe to stay in or potentially live in for the rest of your life, some rooms are very dangerous, and some rooms are literally â€˜dead zonesâ€™ where entering them guarantees death. When you travel from room to room, you have to be careful because any room you enter can potentially be your last.

The methods for entering each room can be seemingly random. Potentially normal actions like touching a window, jumping in a puddle, or even touching certain walls can teleport you into another room if you are not careful. Things like this make the Backrooms pretty strange and it gets even stranger. Many of these rooms are home to monsters and eldritch abominations out of HP Lovecraftâ€™s worst nightmares. If you are not careful, you can become one of their victims. For example, there is an eldritch being called "Mother" who can make you her 'child' if you are not careful and all you have to do to be her next victim is touch certain fake windows. These creatures make the Backrooms even more threatening and dangerous to transverse.

Now, there are a few methods to get back to the real world from here, but many of them are few and far between and most intentionally trying to escape will probably die before they make it. In fact, most who survive long enough just call the Backrooms their homes and form colonies to survive in. If you find yourself in the Backrooms, you might find yourself doing the same. In fact, personally, I would only travel far enough to visit certain rooms that - from reading these scary stories - I know I am safe in and once I make it to one of those rooms, I would just live their and call it a day.

Do I think the Backrooms are real? Of course not! However, they are fun to theorize about and think about. I would love to write on this site about each of these rooms and potentially, in the future, have some kind of ARG about the Backrooms and how people could survive if they ended up there. It is so fun to look at these stories and write about them, even if they are entirely fictional. Who knows, one day I might clip out of reality and have to eat my words about the 'Backrooms' not being real...

title: NFTs, what is happening and what is expected
